column4: hello, I just installed a game(Halo CE) and when I open it in wine the resolution is too high, how can I fix this? I can't see anything, my monitors limit is 1366x768@60hz
Open "Configure Wine" and change the monitor resolution
It would be under "Graphics". You can limit the size of the virtual desktop
It didn't work I think the virtual desktop is for icons... instead of placing them(shortcuts) on your gnome desktop.
I know it works that way, becuase I've used it to limit the desktop size of several other applications of mine.
And, no, virtual desktop has nothing to do with icons.
oh- okay, well I tried a few different that I knew should work and they didn't because the application is not following the rules then.
You have to restart the application to make the rules stick.
I did
You restarted Halo CE?
yeah.
notepad isn't constricted to my smaller virtual desktop either...
it works on all areas of my desktop
But the window size of the Wine program should be fixed.
And once it's fixed to a certain size it also is smaller.
for notepad yes. for halo no.
Is there an option within Halo itself to run in a window?
If you can set Halo to run windowized it should abide by the Wine config
there might be, and there is a place to change screen resolution for when it starts too... only one problem I can't see where to click to get to it.
hey... it worked AUTOMAGICALLY
I think it's because I turned the desktop back off... which is weird because it didn't work like that initially. thanks though!
